intro: Tricholaena rosea var. vanheei, commonly known as the red-tailed bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in humid tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking red-tinted leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are typically followed by orange or red berries. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
